pullRequest.title: Add support for setting vert.x address resolver options
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #13214
The properties of vert.x AddressResolverOptions can now be set using
Quarkus properties.
This is my first PR for Quarkus. I only added a few properties for now in order to check if this is going in the right direction. Once I am on the right track, I will add the remaining properties as well ...

nodes.bodyText: We prefer to avoid lambdas and method references in here for pure performance reasons. And yes, I know it sucks :)
I am thinking of wether to add a default value here, values can be taken from AddressResolverOptions.DEFAULT_CACHE_MAX_TIME_TO_LIVE This is mainly for the generated docs.

Can you describe (with words) what does the default value represent?
It seems to be "forever"
I don't think you need to specify a default value here for any of these attributes, since you're already handling that in the recorder class

commit.message:
Add support for setting vert.x address resolver options

The following properties of vert.x AddressResolverOptions can now be set
using Quarkus properties:
- cacheMinTimeToLive
- cacheMaxTimeToLive
- cacheNegativeTimeToLive
